message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.DS

Reasoning: 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is the most likely category as the paper discusses access control mechanisms and security properties. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering) is also likely as the paper discusses the design and maintenance of policy-based specifications. 
- cs.PL (Programming Languages) is relevant as the paper discusses the use of attributes in policy-based access control. 
- cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) is relevant as the paper formalizes properties regarding the structure of policies. 
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is less likely but still possible as the paper discusses an approach towards automatised verification.
